title: Community-based Organizational Assessment Capacity Building: Mathematical Modeling and Statistical Analysis Instructional Design Expert Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of assessment methodologies, organizational development theories, community-based project experience, proficiency in basic statistics (mean/variance/standard deviation) and data analysis, basic graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment for strengthening practical competencies. Focuses on developing evaluation systems using mathematical calculations (matrix operations) and data visualization tools (Tableau, Python Matplotlib). Learners apply probability models and statistical analysis techniques using real organizational data.

learning_goals: Learners acquire instructional design competencies to develop evaluation systems for community-based organizations using mathematical modeling and probability distribution analysis.

Learners apply probabilistic elements of organizational change models (e.g., Markov chains) and statistical analyses of stakeholder motivation strategies (e.g., regression analysis) to evaluation competency enhancement programs.

Learners plan, execute, and evaluate community-sector-specific evaluation competency development projects using mathematical formulas (e.g., optimization equations) and graph tools (e.g., visualization software).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
